Topic.Title: Categories are now live on textadventures.co.uk

Posts.EditableText:
Categories are now visible on [url:2axblxf4]http://www.textadventures.co.uk[/url:2axblxf4].

I've split "Latest additions" into two sections:

- "Newest Games" shows you the latest games that have been categorised and aren't in the Sandpit.
- "Latest Uploads" shows everything.

When you click "Browse Games" it will default to "All categorised" games, which excludes the Sandpit.

There's also a new "Browse by category" section on the front page.

Currently, a game can only be assigned to a category by a moderator. When you upload a game, it will initially be placed in "Uncategorised".

Please let me know if you disagree with the category of any of the games, and I'll have a look and change it if necessary.

Also please let me know if you have suggestions for any other categories. There should already be some games that would fit into the category, so don't just suggest a type of game you'd like to see - I won't be adding empty categories.

Any suggestions, comments or questions, please post here to let me know...

Posts.EditableText: The sandpit category doesn't mean it's a "crap" game all the time. It is also meant for experimental games. However, what davidw has pointed out (and many agree with this idea) is that most of the games actually are just bad. So to get rid of the "bad" category, you'll just have to assume all the games are bad and they are selected for other special categories. Bad comedy Bad adult Bad Educational and so on The sandpit category at least gives some kind of warning to the player. Although I am pretty sure I saw some games floating in non-sandpit categories that should have been in the sandpit. I am one of the mods and I tried not to re-rate games but now that I know another certain "mod" is out there categorizing games, I should probably have another look.
